content: round with single_crochet or whatever stitch is indicated for the pattern and move the stitch marker up and continue note instructions for sewing each piece to the duck is in the section of each piece but it s optional to assemble the duck after completing all pieces as there s no particular order the duck has to be assembled in 2 copyright mysimplicitiesbymn 2025 all rights reserved all single_crochet 1 increase x6 18 r 4 single_crochet 2 increase x6 24 r 5 r 8 single_crochet 24 24 4 rounds r 9 single_crochet 2 decrease x6 18 color change to white fasten_off green r 10 white single_crochet 1 decrease x6 12 r 11 single_crochet 1 increase x6 18 color change to brown fasten_off white r 12 brown single_crochet 2 increase x6 24 single_crochet 1 st after the last increase r 13 chain 7 turn starting in 2nd chain from the hook and into the back bumps of the chain single_crochet 6 single_crochet 3 increase x5 single_crochet 3 1 decrease the last decrease will overlap into the chain 40 counting both sides of the chain but not counting the 1 turning chain on the end place marker on the last st r 14 single_crochet 4 increase x2 turning around the end of the chain to work the other side of the chain working in the round don t work into the 1 turning chain single_crochet 4 1 decrease single_crochet 26 1 decrease 40 r 15 r 16 single_crochet 40 40 2 rounds r 17 single_crochet 4 decrease x3 on end of tail single_crochet 13 1 increase single_crochet 2 x2 1 increase single_crochet 10 40 r 18 single_crochet 2 decrease x10 30 r 19 single_crochet 1 decrease x4 single_crochet 8 1 decrease single_crochet 1 1 decrease single_crochet 8 24 pause here and insert eyes between row 6 and 7 of the head with 7 or 8 stitches in between the 3 copyright mysimplicitiesbymn 2025 all rights x6 18 r 21 single_crochet 1 decrease x6 12 r 22 decrease x5 7 fasten_off and sew closed ❖ wings brown yarn 4 25mm hook chain 3 make a circle by slip stitching to the first chain r 1 chain 3 counts
